intro: Fumaria pauciflora, commonly known as the lesser smokeplant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, nodding yellow flowers and slender, hairy stems. Native to southern Europe and western Asia, this plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and open habitats. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy surface, while the flowers bloom in early summer. It is a relatively small plant, usually reaching heights of only a few centimeters, making it a subtle yet distinctive addition to its native environment.
